summary: This bill, the Dyess Air Base Access Infrastructure Design Act, mandates the Secretary of the Air Force to undertake planning and design activities for infrastructure improvements at Dyess Air Force Base in Texas. Specifically, it focuses on the Tye Gate and Arnold Gate. The Tye Gate project is allocated up to $17 million, and the Arnold Gate project is allocated up to $12.065 million.  The bill specifies design considerations for each gate, including utility crossings, site congestion, and phased construction, and states the projects will use existing funds allocated for planning and design under military construction accounts.
